dataset.title: Rain Gage sensor data, telemetered and compiled with maps and graphing BES ID 611-

abstract.para: This web site has been created by CUERE where raw BES raingage sensor data can be obtained (that is telemetered into the TRC). http://hydro2.umbc.edu/Precip/ This is actively managed by CUERE.

keywordSet.keyword: rainfall, rain, gage, carrie murray, rain, precipitation, sensor, telemetry, Carrie Murray Nature Center, Carroll Park Golf Course, Dead Run Near Catonsville, Glyndon Elementary School, Gwynns Falls Near Delight, McDonogh School, Oregon Ridge Park, UMBC
Baltimore, MD, Washington, D.C, Chesapeake Bay, Baltimore-Washington, Maryland

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: The Baltimore Ecosystem Study ultimately will conduct research and educational activities throughout the Baltimore metropolitan area. This large area includes Baltimore City, Baltimore County, and the counties of Ann Arundel, Carrol, Harford, Howard, and Montgomery. Gwynns Falls includes agricultural lands, recently suburbanized areas, established suburbs, and dense urban areas having residential, commercial and open spaces. In addition, a reference area has been established in a forested catchment of the Gunpowder drainage in Oregon Ridge County Park.

publisher.organizationName: The scientists, the BES-LTER Program, the University of Maryland, and Cary Institute must receive adequate acknowledgement for the use of data by other scientists, and the BES LTER program must receive copies of any publication using that data. Baltimore Ecosystem Study
